Excerpt

At age 34 Timothy Berners-Lee—"TimBL" on the net—invents the world wide web as we know today.

Between 1989-1994 he and his team at CERN / Switzerland created the first website together with the first web server.

Technologies used in his invention—HTTP—Hypertext Transfer Protocol and HTML—Hypertext Markup Language—are still the foundations of every website today.

The First Website

Summary

The internet was a lively place before the web.

People built communities via Bulletin Board Systems (BBS)
